## Return Value

A newly-initialized bus object, or `nil` if the operation failed.

## Discussion

Audio units can generally be expected to support the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioFormat] standard format (deinterleaved 32-bit float), at any sample rate.

Channel counts can be more complex. See the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AUAudioUnit/channelCapabilities] reference for a more complete discussion.

Initialization will fail and return an error if the specified format is unsupported for the bus.

# init(format:)

**Initializer**

Initializes a bus object with a specific format.

## Declaration

```swift
init(format: AVAudioFormat) throws
```

## Parameters

- **format**: The initial audio format.

## Return Value

A newly-initialized bus object, or `nil` if the operation failed.

## Discussion

Audio units can generally be expected to support the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioFormat] standard format (deinterleaved 32-bit float), at any sample rate.

Channel counts can be more complex. See the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AUAudioUnit/channelCapabilities] reference for a more complete discussion.

Initialization will fail and return an error if the specified format is unsupported for the bus.



## Audio Unit Implementations

- **supportedChannelCounts**: An array of numbers indicating the supported number of channels for this bus.
- **maximumChannelCount**: The maximum number of channels supported for this bus.
